did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Christian Lacy: Tale of the Salem Witchcraft 1801-1860

origination.label: Creator
origination.persname: James, G. P. R. (George Payne Rainsford), 1801?-1860.

did.abstract: Bound holographic manuscript, written in ink, and containing James' edits and signature. This romance story is set in Salem, Mass. in 1691; the main characters are devoted to each other in spite of witchcraft charges against Lacy's mother.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: It is the responsibility of the user to obtain permission to publish from the owner of the copyright (the institution, the creator of the record, the author or his/her transferees, heirs, legates, or literary executors). prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Christian Lacy: Tale of the Salem Witchcraft (MS 061). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: British novelist. Note included states that James was "led to an appointment about 1850 as consul to Massachusetts, where the present story must have been written."

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized by chapters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Bound holographic manuscript, written in ink, and containing James' edits and signature. This romance story is set in Salem, Mass. in 1691; the main characters are devoted to each other in spite of witchcraft charges against Lacy's mother.
